remarks: The morphism part of the Hom functor, for morphisms ` <. f , g >. : <. X , Y >. --> <. Z , W >. ` (which since the first argument is contravariant means morphisms ` f : Z --> X ` and ` g : Y --> W ` ), yields a function (a morphism of ` SetCat ` ) mapping ` h : X --> Y ` to ` g o. h o. f : Z --> W ` .  (Contributed by Mario Carneiro, 15-Jan-2017.)
